segments.text: I see the water overflowing from the sink, and it’s just getting worse by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing right in the middle of it, drying a plate like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the way the water is streaming down the cabinets, ruining the wood and making the floor slippery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s going to regret not turning off the faucet sooner.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are completely focused on the cookie jar, unaware of the mess around them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy balancing on that stool, and I just know he’s going to fall any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is standing there with her hand out, waiting for a cookie, and it’s almost cute if it weren’t so dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will notice any of this before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole kitchen is a disaster waiting to happen, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off that faucet before the whole place floods.
segments.speaker: PAR
